intro: Sedum paradisum, commonly known as the paradise sedum, is a succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It features fleshy, upright stems and small, star-shaped leaves that are typically green with a bluish tinge. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers during the summer months, adding a striking visual element to its appearance. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and ornamental gardening.
